page.title: 11EDUCATION COLLEGE
page.content: The CORNWALL COLLEGE OF AGRICULTURE was formed in September,1984.on 45o acres in E.Cornwall previously farmed as Duchy Home Farm.The College will accomodate 4o full time students a year;provide Day Release courses for young people already working in agriculture and offer refresher courses to mature students.Students may take City and Guild examinations Phase 1-4.New attractive student accomodation stands on a bus route a mile from the A388 road.A long drive lined on either side with trees leads to a gracious Georgian house looking over rolling grassland with many small spinneys.Adjacent stone barns have been converted into lecture rooms, a laboratory and a refectory.A range of hot houses is planned.Mr.Roy Bray is the first Farms Director and Senior Lecturer.
